alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Henry; Owen (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 19 at 10:10AM EST until February 22 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Kentucky... Kentucky River at Lockport Lock affecting Henry, Owen and Carroll Counties. .Heavy rain from the past week have caused the river to rise. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Kentucky River at Lockport Lock. * WHEN...Until Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 30.0 feet, Parts of Eagle Creek campground, between Worthville and Perry, flood along KY 355. At 33.0 feet, Low lying roads near the river along and west of KY 355 flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 AM EST Sunday the stage was 32.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tonight to a crest of 33.3 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage Tuesday morning. - Action stage is 30.0 feet. - Flood stage is 33.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: A Flood Advisory means minor flooding is possible and rivers are forecast to exceed bankfull. If you are in the advisory area remain alert to possible flooding, or the possibility of the advisory being upgraded to a warning. Stay tuned to NOAA Weather Radio and your local media for the latest information. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lmk. The next statement will be issued tonight.
